    <title>Interesting libraries</title>
    <id>6</id>
    <revision>
      <id>113</id>

      <comment>/* Algebra/matrix */</comment>
      <text xml:space="preserve">The following source code libraries have been located that may be of interest for biolib mappings:

== Sequence analysis ==

* [http://www.seqan.de/ SeqAn], an open source C++ library of efficient algorithms and data structures for the analysis of sequences with the focus on biological data
* [http://kimura.univ-montp2.fr/BioPP Bio++], a set of Object Oriented libraries written in C++
* [http://www.ebi.ac.uk/emboss/ EMBOSS] tools and libraries ([[NIX]] package exists)
* [http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/IEB/ToolBox/ NCBI] tools and libraries ([[NIX]] package exists)

== Data formats ==

* Affymetrix Fusion SDK (see Bioconductor affyparser)
* Bioconductor microarray loaders

== Algebra/matrix ==

* [http://gmplib.org/ The GNU MP Bignum Library (GMP)], arbitrary precision arithmetic, operating on signed integers, rational numbers, and floating point numbers
* [http://gslwrap.sourceforge.net/index.html The GNU Scientific Library (GSL)], a numerical library for C and C++ programmers
* [http://math.nist.gov/tnt/ The Template Numerical Toolkit (TNT)], a collection of interfaces and reference implementations of numerical objects useful for scientific computing in C++
* [http://www.netlib.org/lapack/ LAPACK -- Linear Algebra PACKage]
* [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blitz%2B%2B blitz++] high performance array/matrix library - optimized for CPU cache pipelining
* [http://pixelglow.com/macstl/ MacSTL] high performance array/matrix library - optimized for within CPU parallel processing (also for Intel)
* [http://www.math.uiowa.edu/~dstewart/meschach/FAQ.meschach Meschach] a fast C library - with support for sparse matrices

Map these functionalities to BioPerl, BioRuby, BioPython, Bioconductor etc.! It can be done.
Feel free to notify us of interesting libraries.</text>
